availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jesse Chappell Newell (Pulaski County, Kentucky, blacksmith and First Lieutenant (U.S.A.))

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Kentucky native. Father of Carrie Jane Newell, William H. Newell, Thomas L. Newell, Mary M. Newell. Married to Margaret Newell. Farmer in Pulaski County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Pulaski County in 1860. Served in 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry as first lieutenant from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 2, p. 109B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, District 1, p. 199.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 358.
KYR-0002-222-0139.
